intro: Capsella bifida, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its small, white flowers bloom in clusters and are followed by distinctive triangular pods that split open to release the seeds. Capsella bifida is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
